entry.def: If equipment or services are upgraded, they are improved or made more efficient.

example.ex: Helicopters have been upgraded and modernized...
example.tran: 直升机已经更新换代，装配了现代化设备。

example.ex: Medical facilities are being reorganized and upgraded.
example.tran: 正在对医疗设施进行重组和升级。

entry.def: If someone is upgraded, their job or status is changed so that they become more important or receive more money.

example.ex: He was upgraded to security guard.

entry.def: If you upgrade or are upgraded, you change something such as your air ticket or your hotel room to one that is more expensive.

example.ex: You can upgrade from self-catering accommodation to a hotel.
example.tran: 您可以将自理膳食旅店升级为酒店。

means.word_mean: 1. an upward slope or grade (as in a road);

sentences.sentence: "the car couldn't make it up the rise"

means.word_mean: 2. software that provides better performance than an earlier version did

sentences.sentence: "I got an upgrade to first class when coach class was full"

means.word_mean: 4. the property possessed by a slope or surface that rises
5. hardware that provides better performance than an earlier version did
6. the act of improving something (especially machinery) by raising it to a higher grade (as by adding or replacing components);

sentences.sentence: "the power plant received a new upgrade"

means.word_mean: 1. rate higher; raise in value or esteem
2. to improve, especially something that was old or outdated;

sentences.sentence: "I've upgraded my computer so I can run better software"

means.word_mean: 3. give a promotion to or assign to a higher position;

sentences.sentence: "John was kicked upstairs when a replacement was hired"
"Women tend not to advance in the major law firms"
"I got promoted after many years of hard work"
"I upgraded to First Class when Coach Class was overbooked"
"The airline upgraded me when I arrived late and Coach Class was full"

stems_affixes.word_buile: de向下+grad步,级+ing……的→向下降了→不名誉的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 下坡的, 使降级,小看
stems_affixes.word_buile: down向下+grade[n.等级,级别;年级;分数 v.分等,分级]→向下降级
retro向后+grade等级,级别→向后退步

stems_affixes.value_cn: 摄氏温度计[的];百分度[的]
stems_affixes.word_buile: centi百+grade级,度→adj.&n.摄氏温度计[的];百分度[的]
graduate[n.大学毕业生,研究生 v.大学毕业 adj.毕了业的]+ion表名词→n.毕业[典礼];刻度
down向下+grade[n.等级,级别;年级;分数 v.分等,分级]→向下降级
de向下+grade[n.等级,级别;年级;分数 v.分等,分级]→向下降级
retro向后+grade等级,级别→向后退步
up向上+grade[n.等级,级别;年级;分数 v.分等,分级]→向上升级

Sentence.sentence: And efficiency upgrades (升级) can save more than just the earth; they can help protect property owners from rising power costs.
mobile technology can upgrade professors'eaching tool-kit

sentences.en: Freight trains travel slowly on upgrades into the hills.
They upgraded the land by improving it with new buildings.
sentences.cn: 他们建造新楼房来提高土地的等级。

jushi.english: They upgraded the land by improving it with new buildings.
jushi.chinese: 他们以建造新楼房来提高土地的等级。

jushi.english: We need to upgrade the pay and status of teachers.
jushi.chinese: 我们需要提高教师的工资和地位。
